message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.NE. 

The paper deals with human action recognition using video sequences, which is a problem in computer vision. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is the most likely sub-category. The paper proposes a new neural network architecture, which involves learning independent hidden state transitions of memory cells for individual spatial locations. This suggests that the paper may also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-categories. The paper also mentions the use of multi-modal training, which involves both RGB and optical flow information, indicating that it may also belong to cs.MM (Multimedia) sub-category. Finally, the paper involves the use of LSTM, which is a type of recurrent neural network, suggesting that it may also belong to cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) sub-category.
